name: An African Villa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009
reviews.text: The only regret that I have about "An African Villa" is that we only stayed one night. I discovered this property when perusing Trip Advisor and the reviews were so extraordinary that I had to see it for myself.
reviews.title: Fashion meets Flair

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reviews, words and photos cannot describe this perfect experience. We were greeting by Louis who is the interior designer who manifested the coffee table book interior. Taking for us a tour of the interior public rooms, we felt as though we were one of the family not just an overnight guest. Louis used to be a buyer for various stores and made many trips abroad to shop internationally and it shows in the choices which he made in this historical set of 3 joined buildings with the access of great eating establishments and Table Mountain so nearby off Kloof Road.
reviews.title: Look no further!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was large and quiet with a lovely view overlooking the rear garden with reflecting pool. Amenities like computers in one of the public rooms, honor bar and snacks available 24/7 in the kitchen and proximity to a happening neighborhood were much appreciated. There are several large public rooms on the first floor, great for lounging or enjoying a beverage. Also there is secure parking in this neighborhood.
reviews.title: The friendliest place to stay in Cape Town.
What a gem!
reviews.text: We had to depart at the crack of dawn, the day after arrival and consequently missed the breakfast spread but the large bag of to go goodies provided us with ample noruishment the next morning and well into the following day.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The night attendant was very kind, giving us our to go bag and helping us load up our car for our trip out of town.
reviews.title: Elegant and Comfortable with Wonderful Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed for three nights in August--perfect introduction to Cape Town. Situated in a trendy, safe neighborhood with great restaurants and shops within walking distance. Owners and staff were professional and friendly. Villa comprises three converted townhomes--beautiful decor, original details, excellent breakfasts, luxurious bedding. Those in search of absolute silence should remember this is an older house--floors creak, voices travel a bit. But tucked away in a corner of the city, you won't hear traffic or loud music. Stylish and sophisticated yet warm and inviting haven after a long day of sightseeing.
reviews.title: Beautiful Villa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: My husband, sister, niece and I stayed for a few nights in March, and loved it. Both of our rooms were lovely. We were made to feel very welcome and received insight and assistance that allowed us to make the most of our short stay. If there was one surprise it was that we didn't realize that we wouldn't be able to walk everywhere from the Villa. But an affordable rental car was quickly arranged for us, so it worked out just fine. We found the hotel through TripAdvisor; thanks!
reviews.title: simply perfect!

likes.liked: — The decor, service, staff and amenities.

reviews.title: Hosptiality at its best
reviews.text: Owners Louis and Jimmy appear to run this place in an effortless and laid back way. But to be this good there must be an awful lot of hard work going on behind the scenes to ensure everyone has a fantastic time.

reviews.title: Outstanding!
reviews.text: Previous reviews have highlighted so many of the good points so I will only make a few additional comments:

reviews.title: Boutique Brilliance: Wonderful, wonderful, wonderful...
reviews.text: 1. Seek out their advice before you travel. We got help with car hire (very cost effective!), a trip to Robben Island and organising two days of escorted tours with the fantastic Tania.

reviews.title: Faultless!
reviews.text: 2. Make the most of Louis' introductory meeting - his advice on where to eat and places to visit was spot on for us. Manola, within walking distance, was our favourite restaurant.

reviews.title: Beautiful hotel
reviews.text: 3. Take time to just chill out at the villa in the lounges or garden, it is so relaxing. This place is proper Cape Town, not some anonymous chain hotel.

reviews.title: A wonderful end to a wonderful holiday
reviews.text: We ended our South African holiday with a 1 night stay at An African Villa. If we'd known how wonderful it is, we would have definitely stayed longer!

reviews.title: Another glowing review
reviews.text: We arrived late in the evening, to be met by a very friendly Jimmy, who showed us our lovely room - 4 poster bed, very spacious, modern decor, with large balcony.

reviews.title: Outstanding
reviews.text: The attention to detail and the guesthouse as a whole is faultless - you can see how much pride Louis and Jimmy have taken in the restoration of these 3 Cape villas and it really does show in the final result.

reviews.title: Don't stay anywhere else
reviews.text: Don't make the same mistake that we did - An African Villa absolutely deserves at least a 2 night stay!

reviews.title: BEST VALUE IN CAPE TOWN
reviews.text: Keith & Shona, Edinburgh

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I completed a 27 day cruise recently , disembarking in Cape Town. I had found An African Villa on the Web, and booked directly. We had a most enjoyable stay with Louis and Jimmy and their excellent staff. This is a B and B above and beyond what you might normally expect. I recommend it wholeheartedly.
reviews.title: An excellent B and B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: R. B. Ireland, KINGWOOD, Texas
reviews.title: Believe the hype

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Confirmation of what everyone else has been saying - this is a wonderful place to stay and I didn't feel we'd missed out at all by not being in the Waterfront area, quite the opposite in fact.
reviews.title: Outstanding style & value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled solo
reviews.text: Everything about this property works - great breakfasts, reasonably priced laundry, free Internet, honesty bar etc. I really hope the standard is maintained and that complacency doesn't set in after all the rave reviews.
reviews.title: Stunning.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I don't know. Everything about this place was perfect. The staff were uniformly gracious and helpful. The breakfasts were bountiful and delicious. The public rooms and our bedroom were visions of chic decor. Every little thing that you could think of was provided for.
reviews.title: How could they improve?
Fantastic place to stay
reviews.text: A word of warning. If you're visiting Cape Town between December and Easter, book this place early. We decided at the last minute to stay on in Cape Town for another day and An African Villa was booked solid for the next four weeks.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We picked An Africa Villa for part of our honeymoon because of the reviews we saw here. After staying there for 3 days I can whole-heartedly agree with them. Good location, great decor, very nice room, but most of all the friendliness and helpfulness of the owners. Louis and Keith in particular went out of their way to help us orient ourselves, suggested places to go and restaurants to eat in, booked taxis etc. We would definitely choose this place again. Love it!
reviews.title: a word of warning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Like most reviewers, we found An African Villa to be a very good Cape Town base - stylish, efficient, helpful. Until we left, our only niggle was the rather embarrassing having to change from our 11 hour flight clothes in the lounge, Understandably, our room was not ready but brief use of it, or another room would have been helpful.
reviews.title: Great place with very helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Our real problem was with the car hire company, not only recommended by African Villa, but actually booked via their website. The grade of car booked and confirmed well in advance was not available. We were forced to accept their most basic vehicle - 11 days we suffered its inadequacies - and instead of promised compensation all we received was the reduced rate for the actual car given. Advice? Go with a more substantial company with some depth of fleet, offices and efficiency.
reviews.title: Loved this place - and very conveniently located for Table Mountain

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We have previously stayed at Liberty Lodge when it was owned by Jimmy and Louis and loved it there. However, An African Villa surpassed all our expectations. The decor was stunning, the staff friendly and welcoming and we really did feel that nothing was too much trouble and we could treat the place as our own home.
reviews.title: Home from home

likes.liked: — Relaxed atmosphere - warm and friendly staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend An African Villa to anyone, either new to Cape Town or returnees, but be sure to book well in advance!
reviews.title: wonderful place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we had a wonderful week in African Villa. Louis and Jimmy were very helpfull, the perfect hosts. The rooms and the whole house is really wonderfull. Pool is a bit small but you are not realy far from the sea. Good restaurant recomendations. lovely place. we will return.
reviews.title: Great place to stay - couldn't fault the hospitality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great place and everyone was so helpful and informative - You are given an initial "orientation" of the villa and then of everything to do/see/go with very good information - nothing was too much trouble. Room was very clean and well kept and breakfast was beautiful sat outside next to the pool and fountains. There are many restaurants around - do try the Millers Thumb - but book as it gets busy - it is a free phone call from the villa and just a few minutes walk away - it was so good we tried to go back agin - but couldn't get a table! We would definetly stay at the African Villa again - highly recommended.
reviews.title: Didn't disappoint

likes.liked: — spacious and comfortable bedroom with great view, relaxed friendly atmosphere of hotel
likes.disliked: — no full length mirror in room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We arrived on an early flight so after an orientation talk and coffee with Cindy we were grateful to find that our room was ready. The hotel was just as described on the website, there are lots of sitting areas and they have made the most of the outside space. There was a nice view of Table Mountain from our spacious room. The décor is modern but comfortable and the atmosphere is friendly and relaxed, the place is not so pristine as to make you feel uncomfortable.
reviews.title: Great Location, Great Hosts, Great All Together!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Justifiable high rating. We stayed at the beginning and end of our stay in South Africa and felt on our return we were coming back home. Nothing was too much trouble for the owners - any questions were answered immediately, restaurants booked (we loved Aubergine) and advice given willingly.
reviews.title: Helpfulness personified

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: We had a room on the ground floor which opened onto the garden with mirrored doors so that no-one could see inside in the daytime. It made popping in and out so easy when using the pool, kitchen, garden.
reviews.title: Overrated, in my opinion

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was a super friendly atmosphere, but while possibly is not so suited for business purposes, for those visiting Cape Town for tourism it could not be more friendly. Restaurants are in an easy stroll, even at nighttime it felt safe.
reviews.title: This is a perfect little hotel, a real Gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Try the afternoon tea at the Mount Nelson Hotel (but be sure to book first). Cucumber sandwiches, scones, cakes innumerable, even a diabetic tea for me, though unnecessary as the choice of savouries was great.
reviews.title: Would move in if I could!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My experience was very different from other reviewers'. Not bad, just not at all spectacular. I was so excited after reading the reviews here that I left the hotel I was in on business to stay at An African Villa. The decor is lovely. The people seemed nice enough... very, very busy. Breakfast was good.
reviews.title: Faultless

description: This Villa is much more than that! It is in fact three houses which are part of a Victorian terrace dating from 1892. The double story houses have been joined together and so the inside spaces are much larger than the facade suggests. It's like walking into a TARDIS someone has written on Tripadvisor! There are 12 rooms and the hotel is owner managed.Location is vital when choosing a spot for you vacation and this more than a Villa is within an easy walk of all tourist attractions in the city area. The others (like the fabulous beaches) are a short taxi ride away.There is a small plunge pool in a peaceful courtyard where a very full breakfast is served in summer. (In winter there's a sociable dining room and an eco-friendly fire blazing). Your hosts are very careful to offer you as much information as you want and they will arrange car rental, restaurant reservations, tours etc. as required.Free internet on 2 computers in a library area and wireless access is available in all rooms. At night the night porter will set out complimentary sherry and port and at other times there is an honesty bar in the kitchen. Parking is on street and there is no charge (street guards patrol) but you should not need a car from this well placed hotel.
